intro: Pilea glaberrima var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pilea, is a species of flowering plant in the Araceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its upright growth habit and heart-shaped, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are borne on a spadix, typical of the Araceae family. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Its compact size and attractive foliage make it a versatile and low-maintenance houseplant.
